results.title: Senior Product Manager, Ground
results.description:
About DroneDeploy
We’re the leading drone software provider making commercial drone data accessible to anyone, anywhere. Trusted by users across various industries, we’re transforming how businesses collect, manage, and analyze worksite data. Our user-friendly platform makes it possible for companies of any size to improve their workflows through scalable image processing, data storage, and real-time sharable drone maps and 3D models. 
 
We are committed to a global work environment that empowers employees to innovate, grow professionally, and make meaningful impacts. We’re recognized as a # 1 Best Place to Work in the SF Bay Area and have made the Top 200 list of America’s Best Startups. Our employees are creative, driven, and committed to providing our customers with the best drone software in the industry. Our office locations include San Francisco, California | Sydney, Australia | Auckland, New Zealand.
 
Role Overview
This role can be worked 100% remotely or in a hybrid manner from our San Francisco Office.
 
DroneDeploy’s product & engineering team works to bring game-changing computer vision technology to market to improve safety and efficiency for every job site. Over 1 Million datasets are uploaded to our platform each year, with 3D Aerial and Ground data being generated in over 200 countries worldwide. DroneDeploy’s product team is highly customer-focused, and you should expect to spend a lot of time with our customers, including travel to job sites. You’ll develop your own product vision and a strategy that will make the largest possible impact on the market.
 
We are looking for an experienced product manager to join our Ground data team to own the web experience on our StructionSite & Walkthrough platforms, accelerating DroneDeploy’s business in the Construction and Energy industries. You will be responsible for our web strategy, prioritizing the most pressing problems for our customers, and developing the right tools and workflows that provide the most impactful solutions. You’ll deliver intuitive user experiences that delight and engage customers. DroneDeploy’s Ground product is our fastest growing and you will need to work cross-functionally across product, engineering, sales, and marketing to deliver on the massive growth opportunity.



Responsibilities
  • Develop product strategy & roadmap for our StructionSite and Walkthrough products, in partnership with the Director Of Product - Ground.
  • Deeply understand our customers and prospects in the Construction and Energy Verticals. Learn about and clearly document their goals & frustrations. Educate the team on your research. 
  • Partner closely with your partners in Design and Engineering, delivering pragmatic solutions that drive significant value for customers. You’ll be contributing to strategy across multiple teams, investing about $2-3M of developer time each year.
  • Lead product decisions on priorities, help resolve issues and develop and communicate your roadmap to the company and your team.
  • Develop a clear revenue growth plan, and contribute to our packaging approach. Help the Go to Market team to focus their efforts.
  • Lead high-level relationships with strategic partners where they connect to your product.
  • Own the delivery of the product through launch, customer acquisition, adoption, activity, and long-term iteration and improvements.



Requirements
  • 4+ years experience in building SAAS products.
  • Day-to-day experience as a Product Owner in an agile environment with a dedicated development team.
  • Experience delivering full-stack product features to customers.
  • Comfortable seeking and using product usage tracking or operational data & data analysis tools to drive product decisions.
  • Able to work between Monday - Friday, 8-5 pm PST.
  • Available to travel domestically and internationally occasionally for work-related events such as conferences, customer meetings, company in-person gatherings, pieces of training, and other business needs.
  • BONUS: Experience using UI/UX tools such as Figma, Sketch, InVision, Zeplin.io
#LI-Remote
 
Employee Offerings & Benefits include:
(may vary by location)
Innovative company culture
Drone pilot certification
Flexible work schedules
Flexible work location
Family paid leave
Paid healthcare for employees
Professional development & career advancements
Wellbeing activities (live & on-demand)
Flexible paid time off
Employee referral bonus
Commuter savings
 
DroneDeploy is an equal opportunity employer.
 
All DroneDeploy employees are responsible for assisting in protecting the company and customer data by following information security policies and procedures.
 
Please refer to our Recruitment Privacy Notice for information about privacy during the recruiting process.

results.title: Head of Product
results.description:
Head of Product

Who is Serotonin?

Serotonin is the leading breakthrough marketing and communications partner for digital asset companies, working with the top businesses and entrepreneurs in the industry on brand positioning, media relations, content, growth marketing, and go-to-market strategy. We bring together a deep expertise in financial services, digital assets, and decentralizing technologies to help innovators tackle some of the biggest challenges facing business and society by building the next generation of products, services, and experiences.

About the role.

Serotonin is seeking an experienced Head of Product to build Serotonin’s next product. This person will work with the key stakeholders and develop this product from 0-1. This Head of Product will identify, hire, and manage their team to ensure the long term success of this product. The ideal candidate should have 6-10+ years of experience building products from inception to launch for early and growth-stage technology companies; and should be well versed in fintech and/or web3 technology. 

Responsibilities

  • Own the vision, strategy, roadmap, and delivery for Serotonin’s next product. 
  • Develop a deep understanding of all stakeholders - leadership, founders, and other community members - and how to incentivize growth of a flywheel among them.
  • Partner effectively with other internal stakeholders internally to influence priorities and drive alignment
  • Monitor project execution and ensure that the project delivery is to the appropriate levels of quality and in line with target dates
  • Hire, mentor, and retain a team of high-performing professionals
  • Ability to drive out clarity from ambiguity and thrive (opportunity, vision, strategy, roadmap, go-to-market)
  • Consistently executes on fast feedback loops (build, measure, learn)
  • Works closely with customers and adjacent internal teams (marketing, legal, etc) to produce positive outcomes
  • Conduct market research to develop a deep understanding of our users' needs and to conceptualize new updates/features that customers will want.
  • Conduct customer interviews and present key metrics to leadership to track product performance.

Requirements:

  • 6-10 years experience in a leadership product management role. 
  • A proven track record of successful 0-1 product launches.
  • Crypto/web3 native
  • Technologist by experience or education; comfortable communicating high-level benefits and digging into the technical weeds
  • Exceptional and excellent communication skills, both written and spoken
  • Experience working remotely with a globally distributed team

Bonus:

  • Experience working in a fast-paced start-up or agency environment
  • Experience working with emergent technology brands and businesses

results.title: Product Manager
results.description:
Remote, Bratislava
3000 - 5000 EUR/m
Place of work: Remote or office in Bratislava
Type: Full-time, contract
 
About us
Surglogs is a health technology startup that broke through the US market. In less than two years, we have managed to digitize processes for hundreds of surgery centers and hospitals in 47 states in the US. Our platform streamlines the management of medical forms, drug consumption, and employees.
If you are interested in working on the development of our product and want to see the actual results of your work, read on. We are looking for bright people with excellent communication, a pro-customer approach, and a desire to build relationships with our clients.
 
Let our CTO tell you more about your role:
Hi, our future Product Manager👋! I'm Jakub, Co-Founder, and CTO of Surglogs.
I believe that great Product Management is key to building a successful product.
That’s why your role will be crucial for the whole company. 
You will report directly to me and have all the responsibility and freedom you need.
 
You will work with an autonomous product team and manage the product lifecycle from discovery and design to development and launch.
 
Problems create space for innovation. First, you must love and understand the problem, not the solution. Generally, there are only four key contributions you need to bring to your team:
 
- Deep Knowledge of our Customer
- Deep Knowledge of the Data
- Deep Knowledge of our Business and Key Stakeholders
- Deep Knowledge of our Market and Industry
 
I want you to become an expert on our product, users, and customers.
Share what you learn with the team and become a go-to person for the team and the company if someone wants better to understand our product, customers, and their problems.
Honestly said, I need someone who will nurture a strong collaborative and continuous improvement environment, work really hard with the assigned product team, and finally deliver the best ideas to our customers, which will be well aligned with business goals and constraints and will fit all market and industry needs and requirements.
 
You could be a great fit if 
- you have x years of experience with tech product development (ideally Healthcare SaaS)
- you have excellent knowledge of continuous delivery processes
- you have excellent communication and leadership skills
- you have experience with product discovery techniques
- you have experience with prioritization techniques
- you have knowledge of OKRs and their impact on product management
- you have the desire to be the best
 
🦄Benefits and Culture
We are not building teams but friendships.
At Surglogs, culture is essential to us. We help skilled people to excel and take their work to the next level.
 
We offer the following benefits:
- ability to work remotely (anywhere in the world). Yes, companies usually say that but we really mean it. We believe in determination and skills, not location.
- possibility to co-own the company (stock options)
- freedom and flexibility. We don’t clock in and out. We are interested in results, not long approvals and processes. 
- education allowance
- bookclub, internal meetups, company retreats, our awesome merch, and much more

results.title: Devops Engineer
results.description:
About Myria

Myria is building a blockchain gaming ecosystem powered by the Myria blockchain. Our mission is to enhance the power of play through blockchain, enable economic access and ownership, and drive a new era of opportunity, exploration and freedom for every human on Earth. If you get excited by the thought of joining a highly experienced, fast-paced global team and get excited about building the future, this role may be the one for you.
 
About the role
 
Myria is looking for a highly reliable and autonomous DevOps Engineer who will be involved in many different phases of the software application lifecycle including Web Apps and Web Services, Games as well as blockchains & NFT's in the near future.
 
Responsibilities
  • Work in a fast-paced DevSecOps environment and deliver our products to market quickly and efficiently
  • Implement and maintain CI/CD pipeline for deployment and test automation
  • Monitor application health and performance and be proactive in anticipating production issues such as outages, slowness, processing delays, errors and failures, and take corrective action to prevent them
  • Provide continued improvement to the platform infrastructure through automation and standardisation
Requirements
  • Hands-on experience with AWS services (Lambda, ECS, EC2, ALB, ASGs, CW, RDS, SNS, VPC, SG, IAM, SQL/NoSQL, etc but you don't need to know all!)
  • Hands-on experience with Infra as Code (CloudFormation, Pulumi, CDK, or Terraform)
  • Hands-on experience with Docker
  • Experience with monitoring and reliability (this role is more SRE than Sys engineering)
  • Ability to build complete CI/CD workflows - GitLab is preferred
  • Familiarity with GitOps and DevSecOps
  • Basic knowledge in any programming languages: Shell, Bash, Typescript, Go, Python, etc
  • Basic knowledge in popular public & enterprise blockchains, cryptocurrency, smart contract (Solidity), NFTs.

Employee benefits

  • 100% remote roles
  • Unlimited time-off (for full-time Employees)
  • Flexible working hours
  • Competitive salaries

Diversity & Inclusion

Myria is an equal opportunity employer which brings people from all origins and backgrounds together. Our highly diverse team is one of our strongest assets and we have a zero-tolerance approach to any type of discrimination (ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion or belief).

CoinMarketCap is the world’s most trusted and accurate source of data for cryptocurrencies. Used by millions of individuals, organizations, and exchanges, CoinMarketCap brings the most up-to-date market capitalizations, pricing, and cryptocurrency information to our users.

results.title: Editor
results.description:
Project Syndicate is seeking an Editor. This is a full-time position reporting to our Managing Editor and Chief Operating Officer. The primary responsibility of the Editor will be to edit newspaper-length commentaries and, as needed, longer-form content such as book reviews and interviews. The Editor will also be responsible for writing headlines, tag lines, short summaries, and social media posts, and may be tasked with editing and curating features on the PS website and newsletters on an ad hoc basis.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Editing 800-1,000-word commentaries and, on occasion, longer-form content
  • Writing headlines and social media posts for edited commentaries
  • Evaluating and managing unsolicited submissions
  • Assisting with some (minor) website administration and curation of editorial features
  • Occasional editing, curation, and production of editorial newsletters
  • Other editorial tasks as needed

Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Excellent writing ability (US English at a native level of proficiency)
  • Demonstrated interest in, and understanding of, opinion journalism
  • Strong knowledge of, and curiosity about, world affairs, economics, and public policy
  • Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, news-driven environment
  • Flexible schedule 

Preferred:

  • 4+ years of journalism experience in an editing capacity
  • Experience with a CMS and email marketing client (e.g., Mailchimp)
  • Social media fluency

Additional Information: 

  • Full-time position
  • Remote work
  • Competitive salary
  • Dynamic organization

To apply, interested candidates should submit a cover letter, CV, and writing sample to careers@project-syndicate.org.

All submissions must be in English. Submissions without a cover letter will not be considered.

results.title: Copywriter
results.description:
We need copywriter.

 

Our copy bad.

 

Your copy good.

 

Passion.io’s goal is to make the world more confident and passionate. We do this by empowering Creators to launch highly impactful mobile apps with the click of a button. We are an international remote team of 50 people, supporting 7,000+ Creators and 500k+ end-users from all over the world.

 

We’re looking for a copywriter who can give people the FEELS. Someone who can develop creative and compelling copy with a consistent brand voice that differentiates Passion from other brands and engages and educates our Creators.

 

In the beginning, one of your main “clients” will be Customer Success where you will write highly engaging content that educates, nurtures and inspires our customers through their Passion.io journey.

 

You’ll also write for our performance marketing, product, product descriptions and briefs, blog content, white papers, case studies, e-newsletters, other marketing assets, and a lot of other cool sh*t.

Requirements

This is for you if…

  • You are a C2 level English speaker who’s a stickler for grammar and syntax. You’re probably still annoyed about the 3 mistakes in this job-ad so far
  • You have been writing copy professionally for 3+ years and your experience is mainly in writing copy for brands in the SaaS / Software environment
  • You can say a lot with a few words and make the complex simple
  • You empathise with customers and their frustrations
  • You have a good understanding of different support disciplines, like content, social media, SEO, email and online community. You understand how they impact each other and the user journey
  • You’re proactive and recognize opportunities for new and better content
  • You’re great at collaborating —you’re a good listener, problem-solver, and you deliver to deadlines
  • You want to work for a company that isn’t afraid to actually say something

Benefits

What we offer you

  • Steep learning curve: Expect the steepest learning curve you have ever experienced - we are building a playground at passion.io to become the best version of ourselves. Meet and work with successful people worldwide to learn their success secrets.
  • Value-based company: Be part of an open, honest, creative, and results-driven environment where your opinion is highly valued. We want to change the planet for the better by providing value to others.
  • High-growth environment: You will be part of a strongly growing company with the opportunity to develop into a key contributor with incomparable responsibilities.
  • Personal and professional development: You will tackle projects across departments and thereby gain a top-notch tool box to succeed in tackling bigger and bigger challenges.
  • Autonomy / entrepreneurial work-style: You will only be measured by the results you produce and are in the driver’s seat, with full flexibility.
  • Remoteness and flexibility: You will join our truly international remote team from over 10 nationalities and work from anywhere you wish. We are remote since 2018 and do social gatherings in person every quarter — usually in a cool house somewhere on our planet.

results.title: Combat Designer
results.description:
At Counterplay Games, we are in active development for a new action shooter title. We are a fully remote studio with the drive to grow beyond the boundaries and achievements set by our previous games. Our team consists of self-motivated, passionate, and respectful individuals who value a diverse and inclusive environment.

We are seeking a Mid to Senior level Combat Designer to join our Combat Design team. This role reports to our Lead Combat Designer as well as our Design Director. As a member of the greater design team, your contribution will help create our own blend of action shooter and action combat experience in our next title.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop player combat and traversal mechanics, abilities and cameras from initial concept or work-in-progress feature to completion
  • Develop enemy archetypes, enemy variants and AI behaviors from initial concept or work-in-progress feature and content to completion
  • Collaborate with members of Animation, Engineering, VFX, Audio and Art teams to develop prototypes, features, and content by synthesizing their feedback into actionable iterations without losing sight of the greater design goals
  • Stay current on competitive product research and gather references to guide exploration and prototyping of new gameplay features and content
  • Push for quality and best practices to help foster a culture of design excellency
  • Anticipate bottlenecks, problems and limitations in pipelines and processes through different viewpoints and make constructive recommendations to improve them

Requirements:

  • Mid level - 3 to 5 years of combat design experience in FPS or 3rd person action shooter and action combat titles
  • Senior level - 6 to 10 years of combat design experience in FPS or 3rd person action shooter and action combat titles
  • Intermediate to advance level of hands-on feature and content prototyping and authoring experience in Unreal, Unity or other proprietary scripting tools and environments 
  • Analyze and articulate combat gameplay pillars and mechanics that go into creating a holistic combat experience in mainstream FPS and 3rd person action shooter and action combat titles
  • Analyze and articulate enemy archetype design and how archetypes are used to teach, reinforce or disrupt player's play patterns
  • Knowledge of how combat gameplay difficulties are scaled through manipulation of elements on player, enemies and AI behaviors
  • Deep knowledge of ingredients that go into making the right “combat-feel” for different genres of shooters and action combat titles
  • Obsess about fluidity and responsiveness of player mechanics and deep understanding of how these qualities are translated into animation implementation details such as target tracking, frame ranges, blend in and out time, interruption rules, etc.
  • Must be a gamer who loves and is well versed in FPS, 3rd person shooter, action, and action combat games
  • Great knowledge of choreography of action, combat and fight scenes from different mediums (i.e.martial arts, films, anime, comics, etc.)

About VIDA

VIDA is a San Francisco-based Public-Benefits Corporation that offers design-forward, highly effective, and sustainable products that serve the health needs of conscientious consumers. Our products have been featured by publications including NBC, Today, Health, Prevention, VOGUE, Bazaar, Glamour, C|NET, and NPR, among others. VIDA was recognized by Fast Company for the World-Changing Ideas Award of 2021.

About this Role

This is a perfect role to start your career in graphic design at a dynamic and fast-growing start-up. You will be working under the direct supervision of our Sr Graphic Designer with an opportunity to learn a lot in a short period of time and make a difference in this world in creating impactful designs that capture and promote our company vision to benefit the health needs of our customers through our products. 

In this role, you should be highly creative and have a sharp eye for details. If you're passionate about design and eager to learn more, we'd like to meet you.

Your Responsibilities

  • Continue to develop and maintain the brand's creative pillars. 
  • Deliver beautiful, inspiring, refined designs, on tasks large and small
  • Design website updates, packaging, editorial layouts, emails, social media assets, ads, and other marketing work and collaborate across multiple functions
  • Understand project requirements and concepts
  • Produce final design solutions
  • Pitch creative ideas
  • Collaborate with team members and across other teams to launch projects

Requirements

  • At least a Bachelor's degree in Design, Visual Arts, or a related field
  • Experience with design software (i.e. Photoshop, Illustrator)
  • Familiarity with design techniques and knowledge of basic design principles
  • Understanding of visual elements (layout, type, and fonts)
  • Teamwork skills
  • A keen eye for detail
  • Time management and multitasking abilities

We look for people who

  • Create new paths and solutions, rather than follow what everyone else is doing
  • Are honest, open, respectful, and responsible
  • Are hard-working, and ambitious.
  • Appreciate the beautiful design and craftsmanship. 
  • Are kind and thoughtful and caring about their impact on the world.

We offer


The position is a full-time role and is 100% remote. We are ideally looking for someone who is based offshore. Working hours are in the EST time zone. The position comes with a competitive compensation and benefits package.

results.title: Copywriter and Localization Manager
results.description:
The Air Apps team is hiring highly motivated teammates to help build, maintain and market our mobile applications. We are a 100% remote company with just over 50+ employees working across the globe every single day to build products that enrich people's lives. We combine the simplicity and greatness of Apple products by creating utility and productivity apps that make people's lives easier. Our portfolio contains Translate Now & Calculator Air, both the fastest-growing apps in their category. Our apps have been downloaded over 90 million times and received over 2 million ratings with an average of 4.7 stars.

Mission

At Air Apps, we intend to make people's life easier by offering software solutions that allow people to perform their daily activities in work, social, fitness, and learning right from their mobile devices.

About the role

The copywriter and localization manager has a vital role in our Marketing and Product Department. They create clear, concise copy for apps, ads, articles, and marketing material. They ensure the content developed is accessible in other languages, not only in English. They are responsible for creating content to enhance user’s experience with our apps, showcase the benefits of our apps to the rest of the world, attract new users and engage existing ones.

Responsibilities
Content

  • Write the English copy for our product descriptions, articles, marketing campaigns, App Store optimized texts, push and in-app notifications, strings and other ad hoc requests.

  • Incorporate brand voice and follow brand guidelines when producing content and ensure the content upholds authenticity for the users

  • Create content campaigns and designed to meet company targets and broader business goals while analyzing the competition so we can strive to do better

  • Process briefs to deliver content that meet the expected goals and deadlines while making necessary edits based on the team's feedback.

  • Maintain strict standards of quality control to ensure content is consistent, accurate, and relevant for our customers

  • Continuously seek to improve processes and workflows for your areas of responsibility and constantly strive for higher quality outputs

  • Brainstorm ideas with other team members, seek inspiration online, or use other methods that allow your creativity to flourish

  • Collaborate with marketing, product, development, and other design team members

Localization

  • Create content from initial concept to final handoff: handle all aspects of creating and localizing content, from brainstorming, creating, editing, proofreading, managing localization efforts and teams, etc.

  • Manage and oversee the localization strings for App Store optimized text in 37 languages whilst documenting in localization spreadsheets and software

  • Review existing localized text assets and strings.

  • Analyze and implement content creation and localization trends.

  • Maintain a rigorous schedule that meets deadlines, capacity and quality targets. Divide localization task responsibilities by language, delegate them to relevant teams and monitor the work

 
Expected daily activities

  • Write product descriptions, marketing texts and notifications, articles, App Store optimized texts, strings etc.

  • Write clear and error-free content for several online and mobile channels that reflect the company’s voice, brand image and target audience

  • Propose copy concepts in an engaging way for mobile users and carry out projects once they are approved

  • Text editing and proofreading

  • Manage and oversee the localization of English texts into several languages

  • Post content to relevant online and mobile channels

  • Add to content and localization guidelines

  • Collaborate with other marketing team members and across teams on slack

  • Update project statuses on Jira

  • Backup and organize files on Google Drive

  • Manage key paid user acquisition channels while targeting performance ROAS/KPI goals.
  • Manage your channels end to end, including developing channel strategy, defining targeting, managing creatives, setting up campaigns, optimizing campaigns, measuring performance, and driving insights for future campaigns.
  • Use a data-driven approach & a vigorous testing process to evaluate hypotheses and extract insights on strategy and performance.
  • Develop a deep understanding of the customer experience and data flow from acquisition and engagement to drive conversions & revenues.
  • Use reporting and monitoring systems to distill performance to managers regularly.
  • Collaborate with content creators, including the creative team, to help create new and innovative messaging and customer touch-points.
 
Your opportunity

We offer a fully remote, results-driven work style that enhances productivity and quality, providing excellent work-life balance. We also have great opportunities to connect within our international team through coffee calls, team meetings, and hackathons.

  • Proven startup with significant ambitions
  • Highly competitive salary and bonuses
  • Flexible work environment, 100% remote
  • Apple hardware environment
  • USD100.00 Monthly allowance (Home office, Learning, Wellness)
  • USD350.00 Home office set up
  • Get-together: next is in May 2023 → Berlin, Germany

 

Statutory benefits
  • Health insurance (or your country's standard)
  • 24 Annual vacation days (or your country's standard)
  • 10 days sick leave (or your country's standard)
  • 4 weeks parental leave (or your country's standard)
  • National holidays (or your country's standard)
  • Plus any other statutory benefit in your country

You aspire to join an energetic team in a fast-growing startup to develop and grow products at scale. Your desired skills and experience include:

  • Proficient in English

  • Embrace change; able to thrive in a Startup environment

  • 3+ Years as a copywriter and/or localization manager

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Strong time and task management skills

  • Strong eye for detail

  • Be a team player with the ability to effectively communicate with people from different backgrounds and experience levels

  • Work effectively with multi-functional and international teams

  • Work highly collaborative, without any micro-management necessary

  • Work agile and fast, very fast

  • Receive and provide constructive feedback

  • Love remote life and believe in a fluid work/life environment:

  • Find the needle in the haystack mentality and solve problems methodically

  • Juggle multiple projects at the same time

  • Communicate heavily about statuses and issues

  • Manager of one mentality

  • Use Slack and other remote communication/reporting tools

 
What Happens Next?

We expect to review your application ASAP. You'll hear from us within 2-3 days if we decide to invite you to a technical exercise. The exercise is representative of the kind of day-to-day work you'd be doing on the team. We usually only invite candidates to this stage that meet minimum standards, and those candidates should expect to spend about 2-3 hours completing this test.

The next phase of the hiring process will be a video interview with our people operations manager (approx. 30 min). You and she will talk through your background and your approach to remote, teamwork and Air Apps. After the people interview, the top candidates will proceed to the team interview stage. You'll talk with 1-2 members of the team about your technical knowledge, experience and discuss the position (approx. 1h).

The top candidates will proceed to the final interview stage. You'll talk to the leadership team and will align yours and the company's expectations. We aim to make an offer 3-5 days after your final interview.

Please note that we're unable to offer individual feedback during the process. We usually see 1,000+ applications, and our team can't provide personalized feedback. It is a demanding application process. We appreciate you giving us that consideration, and we promise to provide you with our full attention in return.

Disclaimer

This position is fully REMOTE; no re-allocation or visa sponsorship is provided. You will work from any country Air Apps hires in,  however, you will be hired in your legal country of residency.

results.title: Customer Success Agent
results.description:
About IOV Labs
IOV Labs is on a mission to provide the next generation of fintech innovators with the decentralized tools and technology to build a new global economy.
 
IOV Labs operates the RSK Blockchain, a Bitcoin merge-mined smart contracts platform - the most secure smart contract platform in the world. IOV Labs also develops the RSK Infrastructure Framework (RIF) to provide our partners with everything they need to build decentralized apps and new Open Finance services on the RSK Blockchain.
 
We have had early success with partners building ground-breaking Open Finance services on RSK. We are now scaling-up our ambitions, expanding into new markets, and driving transaction growth throughout the RSK EcoSystem.
 
About the Team
Our Customer Success team is focused on guaranteeing the satisfaction of our partners and helping them to get the greatest benefit from our partnership, products and services. They do this through a Customer Success Process that contemplates the full lifecycle of the Partnership, starting from onboarding.
 
About the Role
We are looking for a Customer Success Agent to join the Customer Success team. If you are a tech oriented person with a strong focus on customer satisfaction and user experience and you want to contribute to the revolution at IOV Labs, then this is for you.



Your responsibilities would be:
  • Build strong, long-term relationships with assigned partners, help them with issues, and continually delight them with a positive, customer-centric attitude. Provide proactive strategy with their assigned customer accounts
  • Serve as a product, company and industry ambassador, keen on educating prospects and partners on the capabilities of our services and products. Conduct weekly, quarterly and annual customer success reports to ensure customers optimize our product/service, issues are resolved proactively and partner goals are met.
  • Work closely with Business Development, Support, Product and other Technical teams to ensure an exceptional partner experience and take care of any partner issues
  • Efficiently manage time to focus on essential activities to ensure partner satisfaction, account renewal, and account growth
  • Evaluate risk management for each customer and proactively evade dissatisfaction or lost business and ultimately drive retention throughout the partner life cycle.
  • Collaborate on product designs and influence their roadmaps.
  • Provide insight and relay the voice of partners with internal teams, including Business Development, Marketing, Product, Support, Operations and Integration.
  • Develop and share best practices with team members to continually improve the quality, effectiveness, and efficiency of our processes.



Skills, Knowledge & Abilities
  • At least 3 years in Customer Success, Sales, Business Development or Account Management
  • Proven experience building strong customer relationships and efficiently communicating internal and external voices.
  • Experience working with senior and executive level customer contacts
  • Excellent multitasking and project management skills
  • Advanced English Language Proficiency (bonus points for Spanish, but not essential).
  • Excellent written, verbal, presentation and phone communication skills, with the ability to adapt conversations for technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Experience with agile and Scrum methodologies
  • Experience working by objectives with remote teams
  • Confident, high energy, self-motivated and a true team player
 
BONUS POINTS:
  • Strong interest in and familiarity with technology, knowledge of or experience with customer support tools.
  • Willingness to learn decentralized technologies



Benefits & Perks
  • Competitive salary and bonus. Laptop and other working tools you might need.
  • 100% remote working (contractor) from anywhere in the world.
  • Possibility to work at your nearest WeWork space. 
  • Flexible working hours. You’re free to work however you work best. 
  • Paid holidays and personal leave days. 
  • Opportunity to work with state of art technology in a challenging and unique project. 
  • Internationally diverse and dynamic team with a clear vision and strategy. 
  • Training programs to learn everything about the crypto world. 
  • Weekly scientific moments by our Research & Innovation team to learn about technology, challenges, and solutions in the blockchain world. 
  • Language courses: English, Spanish or Chinese. 
  • Employee assistance program offering legal, financial, family, psychological, and wellness counseling for you and your family. 



IOV Labs Mission, Vision, & Purpose
  • Our purpose is to... build a more decentralized world, for a freer and fairer future
  • Our vision is… a safe and equitable global financial system that enables everyone to participate and prosper
  • We’re on a mission to… provide the next generation of fintech innovators with the decentralized tools and technology to build a new global economy
We are excited to see what you're made of!
 
IOV Labs embraces diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

results.title: [Blockchain] - Backend Nodejs Engineer - (CE)
results.description:
The world's first physical NFT marketplace focused on the collector community. Our client connects the real world and the metaverse. They are a community for people who trade the things they love.They are a completely remote company with no fixed headquarters. Their team is spread across the globe - They form an inclusive network across various locations, lifestyles and backgrounds.The culture is driven by empathy, integrity, strategic thinking, innovation, leadership and a shared desire to perform at their best. While their differences make them adaptable and versatile, their shared values give them the strength and drive to become the open metaverse for collectors.

We are looking for a Backend Developer to join the team of blockchain developers to design and implement products. Your ideal engineer is someone who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment and can adapt to the ever-changing industry.

You will work with the team to - implement functionality, design our system, maintain the health of our code, and continue to grow as an engineer with support from senior team members.

Responsibilities:

Develop products and projects related to backend development, configuration and maintenance around NFT Utilities, Backend to Frontend Integration.

Build core infrastructure software, instrument for performance, and optimize for performance.

Write, test, deploy smart contracts, and build system design around the product.

Build core backend modules such as authentication, session, queues, and schedulers

Write unit and end-to-end test scripts for required modules/packages

Integrate and consume other services/APIs.

Technology stack:

Languages: TypeScript

BE: Node.js / Express

FE: React

DB: MongoDB

Cloud: AW

Requirements

+5-10 years of experience in backend technologies. The main stack is Node.js, so Typescript is preferred. However, they may consider candidates with extensive experience with Java or Python.

Experience with Solidity (Defi smart contracts), Web3, Ethereum and integration of APIs into DApps.

Knowledge of Ethereum/Polygon or other blockchains.

Knowledge and interest in crypto projects covering DeFi, NFTs and DAOs.

Have designed, built, scaled and maintained production services and knowledge to compose a service-oriented product and integrate decentralized technologies, infrastructure and data systems.

What's in it for you?

Be part of building a great project and make a real impact on your career. Work flexible hours from anywhere and be part of a team driven by strong values and a clear shared vision. Directly shape the future of a completely new model for cryptocurrency and blockchain applications.Test your skills and push your creative boundaries by working with the latest technologies and systems. Play an active role in one of human history's most significant technological innovations. Receive a competitive salary paid in crypto.

Benefits:
-- Bonus structure varies between 25 and 100% of annual salary depending on KPIs.
-- 6.5% additional to the monthly salary for the payment of the ETH fees (we pay via USDT only). Payments are 50% on 10 and 50% on 25.
-- Company meetings three times a year in different parts of the world.
-- Computer stack
-- Flexible schedule and very scrum-focused.

Budget: USDT 90-170k per year. This information is for reference only, depending on the candidate's Seniority.

results.title: ML Engineer Intern
results.description:
At Ivy, we’re on a mission to unify all Machine Learning (ML) frameworks, making ML code cleaner, more flexible, and fully reusable. All Ivy functions can be executed using TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, JAX and NumPy, without any change to the code.

We've just raised a round of venture funding (YC, Abstraction, Essence, A Capital). We’re looking for talented developers to join this ambitious endeavor, just as we’re getting started. Hop on board and lets-unify.ai!


We are in talks with developers from Google, Facebook, NVIDIA, Hugging Face, and other top software companies who would like to use Ivy in their popular open-source projects, to instantly support all frameworks. A few examples are: Ray, FastAI, Transformers, PyG, Pyro, Kornia.


Role

We are looking for developers to join our team remotely for 3-12 months with flexible start dates. You will help to extend Ivy’s codebase as we expand into the PyTorch Ecosystem and beyond. The monthly salary will be $2500-4000 depending on experience. We are hiring worldwide, no visa required. During the role, your tasks would include:


● Helping to design Ivy's graph compiler and transpiler, enabling automatic code conversions between frameworks

● Working alongside our open-source partners, helping to incorporate Ivy into their popular repositories

● Implementing SOTA models in Ivy, and adding these to our model hub


Requirements

● Strong Python skills, with expertise in one of: PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX

● Strong skills in recursive programming. Check out the Ivy Container class

● A passion for Machine Learning research, and for our vision to unify the ML frameworks!


Application Instructions

After clicking the apply button, please check your spam, promotion and junk folders every few days. Unfortunately some of our emails are ending up there. We are working hard to fix this asap.

If you have any questions in the meantime, please reach out on the "Join our Team" channel (or direct message the IvyTeam account) in our discord server!

We really look forward to hearing from you! :)

results.title: Senior Applied Scientist
results.description:
We're hiring applied scientists at multiple levels from Senior to Principal!

 

Who we are

Gretel is solving the data bottleneck problem for developers, data scientists and AI/ML researchers by providing them with safe, fast and easy access to data without compromising on accuracy or privacy. To do this, we believe that technical breakthroughs are needed in the synthetic data space to include generative models, differential privacy, and federated learning through generalized, ethically-aware approaches that will work with any kind of data- be it text, structured data, audio, or video.

 

The impact you’ll have

As an Applied Scientist, you will be working on ways to make synthetic data accessible for people everywhere. You'll be building cutting edge technology to unlock real-life use cases with synthetic data generation that our customers are working on today-- including models that can better detect heart disease across genders and ethnicities, financial models that can better respond to unseen data and market changes, and safe datasets that enable medical researchers to share data on rare diseases such as Lymphoma without compromising patient identity.

  • Come up with new ideas or improve upon existing ideas in machine learning, demonstrated by accomplishments such as first author publications, public learning via blog posts and thought leadership pieces, or leading research projects.

  • Be involved in end-to-end development, exploring new applications and techniques within language modeling, generative models for images, audio, and video, improving synthetic tabular data generation algorithms, ethical/fair AI, or privacy enhancing technologies.

  • Conduct research to improve the performance of large ML and AI models using a diverse collection of datasets and community feedback.

     

Requirements

  • M.S. or PhD in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.

  • 3+ years of industry experience in one or more of the following areas:

  • Neural Networks/Deep learning, Generative models (GANs, transformers, language models, etc.), Privacy enhancing technologies (Differential Privacy, Federated learning, etc.), Natural language processing, Computer vision, or Signal processing

  • Strong communication skills -– you are able to clearly express ideas both verbally and in written form. We’re a distributed team so we’re extra mindful about communication.

     

Nice to haves

  • Past experience in creating high-performance implementations of deep learning algorithms

  • Deep experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, HuggingFace, PyTorch, OpenCV, Fairlearn, or MLflow

  • Deep experience with ML techniques such as Transformers, LSTM, GANs, or CNN

  • Experience working remotely in a distributed company

  • Relevant work experience, including full time industry experience

     

At Gretel, we believe that the best ideas come from the blending of diverse perspectives and experiences, which will lead to a stronger company and advancements in technologies. We hire individuals whose peers call them subject matter experts, whose curiosity draws them to new edges of their field and who like to laugh. We are deeply collaborative, apolitical and mission-oriented.

 

Gretel is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Gretel are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

 

Compensation

Employee compensation will be determined based on interview performance, scope of experience, and organizational needs. During the offer discussion, your recruiter will review the finalized base salary, bonus (for applicable roles), benefits and perks (additional information available on our career site), and stock options as they’ll be reflected in the offer letter. 

 

Employees hired in the U.S. and Canada can expect the below information to reflect a reasonable estimate of the salary offered for this role. Salary ranges are updated regularly using premium market data. (Please note: it is unusual for new hires to receive a base salary at the top of the range. Additionally, the value of Gretel.ai’s stock options is not included in the salary bands and may represent a significant portion of your compensation.)

 

Senior Applied Scientist $180,000-$210,000 USD
Staff Applied Scientist $200,000-$230,000 USD
Principal Applied Scientist $220,000-$250,000 USD
